breaks down into two mentalities proactive and reactive routing um in in
a proactive mindset you're you're kind of in your more familiar networking ground right I I go out beforehand I

phone and do all my routing that way so when that happens my phone makes a topographical map of or topological map
of the whole wireless mesh and then I do an analysis of that from like a simple
graph Theory standpoint and I find out exactly how many unique paths I have through that that whole mesh from point
A to B so instead of just finding the optimal route like you normally would I
try to find all of the routes so I have 10 unique routes I can pass data through the mesh I'm going to take every single
data packet that I have to send cut it up into 10 equal sized chunks and send
those on 10 disparate paths that way if any
single person is on the mesh or any subset of the entire mesh is compromised in trying to sniff traffic it becomes
irrelevant it best they get a part of a packet um the only way that you could
fully do a man- in-the-middle attack or any sort of just eavesdropping on a
conversation um would be if you controlled every single note on the mesh except for point a and point B um and a
nutshell that's that's Mercedes it is it is just trying to take the anti-
sniffing game to the complete next level um and it's it's a toy that we can play
with in meshes it's a toy we can play with and other um networking
infrastructures aside from our typical internet where it we don't have just a
single path into the net um so all right the one thing I wanted to add this is
